note: Antarctica does not have an official currency. Various currencies are used depending on the country operating the station.
Bouvet Island is an uninhabited territory of Norway, and it uses Norway’s currency and dial code.
The British Indian Ocean Territory uses the United States Dollar (USD) as its official currency.
Christmas Island is an external territory of Australia and uses the Australian Dollar (AUD) and Australia’s dial code.
The Cocos (Keeling) Islands are an external territory of Australia, and they use the Australian Dollar (AUD) and Australia’s dial code.

countryName: Congo, The Democratic Republic of the Congo

note: The Cook Islands use the New Zealand Dollar (NZD) as their official currency, although they also issue their own Cook Islands Dollars, which are not widely accepted outside the islands.
El Salvador also recognizes Bitcoin as legal tender alongside the United States Dollar.
The Falkland Islands Pound (FKP) is pegged at par with the British Pound (GBP), and the British Pound is also widely accepted.
The Faroe Islands use the Danish Krone (DKK) as their official currency, but they also issue their own Faroese banknotes, which are pegged to the Danish Krone.
The French Southern Territories use the Euro (EUR) as their official currency. The islands are uninhabited except for research stations.
Greenland is an autonomous territory of Denmark and uses the Danish Krone (DKK) as its official currency.
Guernsey issues its own banknotes and coins, but they are pegged to the British Pound (GBP). The British Pound is also accepted.
Heard Island and McDonald Islands are uninhabited Australian external territories and use the Australian Dollar (AUD).
The Isle of Man issues its own Manx Pound, which is pegged to the British Pound (GBP), and the British Pound is also widely accepted.
Jersey issues its own banknotes and coins, but they are pegged to the British Pound (GBP). The British Pound is also widely accepted.

countryName: Korea, Democratic People's Republic of (North Korea)

note: Kosovo unilaterally adopted the Euro (EUR) as its official currency, even though it is not an official member of the Eurozone.
Liechtenstein uses the Swiss Franc (CHF) as its official currency.
Montenegro uses the Euro (EUR) as its official currency, although it is not a member of the Eurozone.
Niue uses the New Zealand Dollar (NZD) as its official currency.

countryName: North Korea (Democratic People's Republic of Korea)

note: The Israeli New Shekel (ILS) is widely used in the Palestinian territories, though the Jordanian Dinar (JOD) and United States Dollar (USD) are also commonly accepted.

countryName: Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha
note: The Saint Helena Pound (SHP) is used, and it is pegged at par with the British Pound (GBP). The British Pound is also widely accepted.

countryName: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
note: As a British Overseas Territory, the islands use the Pound Sterling (GBP).
Svalbard and Jan Mayen are territories of Norway, and they use the Norwegian Krone (NOK).
Tuvalu uses the Australian Dollar (AUD) as its official currency, and Tuvaluan dollars are also issued as commemorative coins.
